channel.title: Girl advice
channel.description:
yes yes don't get your knickers in a twist nothing bad. lol :P
Pretty much this girl I have been seeing for like the past two months has started to tell me that she loves me. To be frank, I don't think I have the same feelings. I do still want to go out with her and have a relationship with her etc. I..just don't know if it's love yet. If that makes sense?
What should I say? I don't want to offend her but at the same time I don't want to enrage her.

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

Tell her that u dont feel the same way and if she truly loves you then she will understand.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:29, topic:468495”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=585463.msg4159750#msg4159750 date=1352945924]

I don’t agree at all. Each to their own i guess.

He’s going by the High School rules.

I’ve been at college for 2 years and I don’t hang around with any of my school friends (exl odd occasion i.e. birthdays) them exl one anymore. The rest of my friends are generally 20+ but ok.

What you posted was bad advice. It’s exactly the kind of relationship advice people in High School go by. You’re pretty much the only one who still argues with me by the way.

Join the Club and hop on my Bandwagon?

Define bad, my way keeps the girl happy and I’m happy that their happy. If they piss me off then I tell em, theirs no major problem. It may not be morally correct but who cares; it works.
[/quote]

I didn’t mean it was completely bad advice, and nobody should listen to it. I just meant that It’s bad advice for the Original Poster to follow. I should have clarified; my apologies.[/quote]
Define bad for the OP. You can’t define whats good or bad unless you know what is defined as a good outcome and a bad outcome. The outcomes are subject to opinions, if a female is jealous and you and someone else broke up they would most probably say the outcome is good where as you would say its bad.
My own advice has just as much value as others and it is purely up to the OP to use it. Its advice s’post to help, not advice s’post to be read, analysed and then feedback given to myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Off topic: This topic was made today and 2 pages worth of comments
On Topic: Just say “I know you love me, and i love you but i’m not really ready. I hope you understand” and walk off…

I think im giving bullshit advice but ok

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I can see where you’re coming from L&P. I’ve just recently gotten over a four year relationship. However, about 3-ish months later, here I am with a new girlfriend. I think it’s just a struggle in trying to get used to a new girl in your life. It is quite a change going from loving one girl to nothing then back to building back those kind of feelings for someone else. So, while I don’t think you’re wrong for not loving the girl back, you definitely do have feelings for her and you need to help her understand that much. You can ask her what she meant by “she loves you”. Does it necessarily mean “she’s IN love” or she “loves” you?

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:20, topic:468495”]well that’s different - reyx7 has no game. L&P can smooth-talk his way into any woman’s pants.[/quote]ha I wish :rolleyes:

[quote=“RSPS Mirrors, post:21, topic:468495”]Hey, was you originally known as Fuckandpower?[/quote]maybe I will never tell

[quote=“LilXCj, post:18, topic:468495”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=585463.msg4159349#msg4159349 date=1352925340]

Refer to this topic and decide whether or not you want Moparscape’s help.
[/quote]i’m here all day for any assistance.

We couldn’t get reyx7 a girlfriend. What makes you think we could help L&P keep one? Haha.[/quote]Well I guess I should had mentioned this first, but I was in a pretty bad break up a few months back. Long story short I had went out with this girl who I DID love like everything…and if I am honest I still do so much it isn’t even funny. Anyway, when Myth-Scape went under cause of meeper she found out I couldn’t support myself/ lost the mortgage/ etc and she pretty much just dumped me :s we had gone out for over two years by that point.

Hell for that matter I was already somewhat considering marriage and we had talked about maybe living with each other etc but it just never happened at that point.

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:15, topic:468495”][quote author=Tree link=topic=585463.msg4159344#msg4159344 date=1352925060]
I don’t agree at all. Each to their own i guess.
[/quote]

He’s going by the High School rules.[/quote]high school doesn’t got anything on real relationships I’m sorry.

thanks guys I plan to go see her tomorrow and so I have the general\ idea of what I will be saying next time she says it so hopefully she won’t biatch slap me or anything lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:11, topic:468495”]Tell her what she wants to hear, best way to keep things good.
Only tell her negative emotions if they affect the relationship i.e. if she is annoying you. i.e. Compliment her, tell her she is annoying but say something funny so she doesn’t get mad.
I have a lot of superficial conversations and they work out just fine with people my age, the older people are generally speaking the more they realise the obvious tactics used haha (saying this cause I learned your 24, so their wont be as many silly females).
And before you think superficial conversations are bad their not, you know good conversation topics so obviously you can use em on multiple people and it doesn’t mean you have superficial emotions.[/quote]

I don’t agree at all. Each to their own i guess.
I prefer my interactions with women to be genuine.

Read full topic

tell her that you’re too ghetto for love.

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Tell her what she wants to hear, best way to keep things good.
Only tell her negative emotions if they affect the relationship i.e. if she is annoying you. i.e. Compliment her, tell her she is annoying but say something funny so she doesn’t get mad.
I have a lot of superficial conversations and they work out just fine with people my age, the older people are generally speaking the more they realise the obvious tactics used haha (saying this cause I learned your 24, so their wont be as many silly females).
And before you think superficial conversations are bad their not, you know good conversation topics so obviously you can use em on multiple people and it doesn’t mean you have superficial emotions.

that’s what I’m afraid of, is that she will leave cause of it being said.
[/quote]

If she does, then she was lying when she said she loves you. Sure, she might be a bit hurt at first, but It’s your job to make her understand. Communication is the #1 factor in relationships.[/quote]
^this.

item.title: Girl advice
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Look deep into her eyes, like as deep as you can. Don’t break eye contact. Then whisper “I love me too.”

or if you can bounce your pecs that will change the subject pretty quickly, use that when she says it.

Read full topic
